advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things we’d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. It’s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means you’re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone and laser sights) give you all the help you’ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee you’ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, you’ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out life’s duality.

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labeled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favourites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

ios.subtitle: pat pet cat, kids animal sim 2

editorialNotes.standard: Orange ball with a moustache, corner pocket! Nail wild trick shots in this clever mashup of billiards and golf.

ios.subtitle: Mad simple game! Jump cars etc

editorialNotes.standard: If you think the concept of simply jumping over objects in an endlessly side-scrolling landscape sounds too basic, think again. This tough-as-nails platformer plays more like a relentless obstacle race, throwing out spikes, pits, and multi-tier pathways that demand impeccable timing to avoid and navigate. Your reflexes and memory will be put to the test.

Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fuelled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AI–and learn a thing or two about yourself–in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

Part platformer, part puzzler, Edge has infatuated gamers almost since the opening of the App Store. Guide a nimble cube around the narrow ledges and ever-shifting corridors of a treacherous 3D world, unlocking secrets and collecting items without falling into space. Stylishly minimalist visuals and a slick electronic soundtrack make Edge’s mix of path-finding challenges and pitfall-avoiding thrills easy to get lost in. Its dozens of levels of perfectly balanced gameplay redefine how much fun simplicity and sophistication can be.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

editorialNotes.standard: The makers of the awesomely chaotic Does Not Commute have returned with a very different sort of game, casting you as a lab tech who must recapture subatomic particles as they drift away from an atomic core. Connecting coloured dots might sound simple enough, but every neuron in your decidedly non-mechanical brain will be firing as you extend your particle strings and snag valuable score multipliers. Soothing ambient music perfectly complements the intense focus required to master each rewarding level. Who said lab work was boring?

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

editorialNotes.standard: Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide they’re tired of getting captured. It’s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personality—and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

name: 箱庭便利店:超市经营模拟器
artistName: Shenzhen Jingying Network Technology Co., Ltd.
